schema.description: Operational state data for each component

Temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. Values include
the instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics. If
avg/min/max statistics are not supported, the target is expected
to just supply the instant value
Operational state data for each property
Operational state data for the subcomponent

platform-component-properties-config.description: System-defined configuration data for component properties

name.description:
System-supplied name of the property -- this is typically
non-configurable

value.description:
Property values can take on a variety of types.  Signed and
unsigned integer types may be provided in smaller sizes,
e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

platform-component-properties-state.description: Operational state data for component properties

configurable.description: Indication whether the property is user-configurable

property.description: List of system properties for the component

state.description: Operational state data for each property

name.description: Reference to the name of the subcomponent

platform-subcomponent-ref-state.description: Operational state data for subcomponent references

platform-subcomponent-ref-top.description: Top-level grouping for list of subcomponent references

name.description: Reference to the name list key

state.description: Operational state data for the subcomponent

name.description:
Device name for the component -- this will not be a
configurable parameter on many implementations

platform-component-state.description: Operational state data for device components.

type.description: Type of component as identified by the system

id.description:
Unique identifier assigned by the system for the
component

mfg-name.description:
System-supplied identifier for the manufacturer of the
component.  This data is particularly useful when a
component manufacturer is different than the overall
device vendor.

hardware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the hardware revision of
the component.

firmware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the version of associated
firmware that is running on the component, if applicable.

software-version.description:
For software components such as operating system or other
software module, this is the version of the currently
running software.

serial-no.description: System-assigned serial number of the component.

part-no.description:
System-assigned part number for the component.  This should
be present in particular if the component is also an FRU
(field replacable unit)

oper-status.description:
If applicable, this reports the current operational status
of the component.

platform-component-temp-alarm-state.description: Temperature alarm data for platform components

alarm-status.description:
A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.

platform-component-power-state.description: Power-related operational state for device components.

allocated-power.description: Power allocated by the system for the component.

used-power.description: Actual power used by the component.

platform-component-temp-state.description: Temperature state data for device components

temperature.description:
Temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. Values include
the instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics. If
avg/min/max statistics are not supported, the target is expected
to just supply the instant value

memory.description:
For components that have associated memory, these values
report information about available and utilized memory.

available.description:
The available memory physically installed, or logically
allocated to the component.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
the component, not considering reserved memory that is
not available for use.

platform-anchors-top.description:
This grouping is used to add containers for components that
are common across systems, but do not have a defined schema
within the openconfig-platform module.  Containers should be
added to this grouping for components that are expected to
exist in multiple systems, with corresponding modules
augmenting the config/state containers directly.

state.description: Operational state data for chassis components

config.description: Configuration data for physical port components

state.description: Operational state data for physical port components

config.description: Configuration data for power supply components

state.description: Operational state data for power supply components
Operational state data for fan components
Operational state data for fabric components
Operational state data for storage components
Operational state data for cpu components

integrated-circuit.description: Data for chip components, such as ASIC, NPUs, etc.

state.description: Operational state data for chip components
Operational state data for backplane components

platform-component-top.description: Top-level grouping for components in the device inventory

components.description: Enclosing container for the components in the system.

component.description: List of components, keyed by component name.

state.description: Operational state data for each component

avg-min-max-instant-stats-precision1-cel.description:
Common grouping for recording temperature values in
Celsius with 1 decimal precision. Values include the
instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
sampling period.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
period

interval.description:
The time interval over which the min/max/average statistics
are computed by the system.

components_schema.description: Enclosing container for the components in the system.

component.description: List of components, keyed by component name.

memory_schema.description:
For components that have associated memory, these values
report information about available and utilized memory.

available.description:
The available memory physically installed, or logically
allocated to the component.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
the component, not considering reserved memory that is
not available for use.

property.description: List of system properties for the component

state.description: Operational state data for the subcomponent
